Ones born of heart and darkness, devoid of hearts, ravage all worlds and bring desolation. Sieze all hearts and consummate the great heart. All hearts to be one, one heart to encompass all. Realize the destiny: the realm of Kingdom hearts. The great darkness sealed within the great heart. Progeny of darkness, come back to the eternal darkness. For the heart of light shall unseal the path, seven hearts, on keyhole, one key to the door. The door of darkness, tied by two keys. The door of darkness to seal the light. None shall pass but shadows, returning to the darkness. One born of the heart and darkness, hunger for every heart untill the dark door opens. im bored so i typed this sucker up from kingdom hearts. me:

hey doods, my sister wrote this letter to the supernintendo of the schools because she is so mad at him, (Written maybe the 15th) and she signed it her name. the other day she got a message from his office to have a meeting with him to talk about the email. good luck katie! here is the email. ~~~~~ to whom it may concern: I know that Mr. Livingston is most likely not going to read this. So could you please forward this to him if that is the case. It has been brought to my attention, that there are several teacher who will not be returning to the high school next year. Way to go. You have by far taken away the best teachers there are. I can not see how you can take away a teacher that we see everyday and know very well and replace them with a new teacher. The thing is, if we "have a budget crisis" or whatever your ridiculous reasoning behind this choice, you will ultimately end up hiring more teachers to replace these ones, and then fire their asses after a few years like you did to the ones this year. Why not get rid of non-essential personal in the school, or even better, expenses that are not necessary. For example, do you, Mr. Livingston, really need a raise every year, when there are all these other expenses that are more important to children's education? Or how about the "curriculum director?" do we really need that? Don’t tell me its because of MCAS. She doesn’t prepare us for that. Was she there when 72 kids were stressed out sophomore year? More importantly, were YOU there? I don’t remember seeing you there. Oh yeah, and this Camilla Huston, who is she? No one has heard of her, other than the ones in your nice big air-conditioned office at the town hall. How about Peter Roche? wouldn’t know him if I saw him. The only one I can match a face with is you. That is only because I was forced as a high school student to sit through speeches, you um, delivered. Were you at the high school award ceremony for the freshman, sophomore, and juniors? I don’t remember seeing you there? But I do however, remember, since my days back at shaker lane, the old superintendent, Mr. Franco, at every single social, academic, and school event. Were you at graduation because you wanted to be there? or because you had to be there? Come to think of it, I hardly ever remember seeing you at school. I think I may have seen you three times, if that. The teachers that aren't going to be there next year are the ones I always saw. The ones that helped me through high school aren't going to be there for other students. As it has been drilled into our heads since you came here and gave us this "mission statement," "our mission is to inspire and sustain learning and achievement, preparing each student for the challenges of life in the 21st century" (www.littletonps.org). You are indeed, Mr. Livingston, preparing us. We are going to have to learn to look for jobs every two or three years in our lives. In addition to "preparing" us, you have given us another lesson in life. That is to not live in Littleton, or whatever town you deicide to destroy after this one. Thank you ~~~~~ i agree with this letter. me:

i like these pictures a lot! they are awesome. scaring the shit out of sisters and their friends is fun. here how i did it... my sister and her friends were on my nanas side so i went out the garage and went outside to the window that is in her bedroom and i knocked on it wicked hard and then went to the door and knocked and i heard them scream, but it was all becca, and i went inside back through the garage. it made my day! lol have fun -llama me:

i HATE littleton. i hate littleton high school. i especially hate FUCKING LIVINGSTON!!!! he can go rot in hell. and shove his paycheck up his roody poo candy ass. why does he let go all the good teachers. i wish i could be old and take over his job and rehire all the good teachers and have him rot in hell. oh i am furius. i am upset. i wonder... when he choses teachers... does he think about the students? -llama

Yesterday katie had ger graduation party. it was good. i saw all my cousins. maggie is sooo cute! shes 4 now. it was good. my nana had an ashma attack. she went to the hospital. shes ok now. i hope she feels better. no finals tomorrow! boo yah -llama

why am i making a blog? maybe to keep me sane, or just to write things out. so this is my blog. nothing great. but its ok. what's up? my back is getting better! not fast but its going to take a wicked long time for the nerves. its all bull shit. nerve damage is the bitch. so this is getting better... but stuff gets worse at the same time. my FAVORITE teacher just told my sister that she wont be re-hired. i think somehow, someway she will be rehired. i have hope. i never have hope for anything and about this i do. i really do. but the doctor says i can take walks and try to swim to get my back muscles going. good bye to "abs of steel" when school is out! i just need to wear it when im in pain. leave a comment or a HI or what ever floats your boat. it doesnt matter peace in -llama

"When I think about my life I wonder if I will survive To live to see 25 or will I just fall? Like all my friends, they just keep dying. People round me, always crying. In this place that I like to call my home. Not everybody knows that everybody goes to a better placeNot everybody knows that everybody could be living their last days But the hard times will come, and we'll keep moving on. We're moving on. Keep moving on Life. Hope. Truth. Trust. Faith. Pride. Love. Lust. Pain. Hate. Lies. Guilt. Laugh. Cry. Live. Die. " -GC Sei mesi. adesso sono peggiore. rinuncio. Nessuno sa ciò che succede eccetto il mio ragazzo. nessuno può dire che sanno che sente come eccetto lui. sei mesi o tre settimane. tre settimane

The person driving in front of you is going 70 mph and you are cursing him for going too slow. When ordering a tonic, you mean a Coke...not quinine water. You actually enjoy driving around rotaries. You almost feel disappointed when someone doesn't flip you the bird when you cut them off or steal their parking space. You know how to pronounce the names of towns like Worcester, Billerica, Haverhill, Barre and Cotuit. You have driven to New Hampshire on a Sunday in order to get beer. You know that there are two Bulger brothers, and that they're both crooks. You know what they sell at a packie. You know at least one bar where you can get something to drink after last call. You can actually find your way around Boston. Evacuation Day is a recognized holiday. You know what First Night is. You know at least one guy named Sean, Pat, Whitey, Red, Bud or Seamus. You think the rest of the country owes you for Thanksgiving and Independence Day. You have never been to Cheers. When the words 'WICKED' and 'GOOD' go together. You knew that there was no chance in hell that the Pats would move to Hartford. You have gone to at least one party at UMass. The curse of the Bambino is taught in public schools. You own a "Yankees Suck" shirt or hat. You think Doug Flutie is the greatest athlete ever. You remember exactly where you were when the ball rolled through Buckner's legs. You pray for the Red Sox to win the World Series not this season, but in your lifetime. You know how to make a frappe. You know that "Big Dig" is also a kind of ice cream you can get at Brigham's. You actually know how to merge from 6 lanes of traffic down to one. You never go to "Cape Cod", you go "down the Cape". You think that Roger Clemens, Wade Boggs and Derek Jeter are more evil than Whitey Bulger. You went to Old Sturbridge Village, Plymouth Plantation, or both, on field trip in grammar school. You're aware that there is a town, somewhere in Massachusetts, named Brimfield where they have the biggest outdoor antique market in the world. You can drive to the mountains and the ocean all in one day. You know that the Mass Pike is some sort of strange weather dividing line. You know that P-Town isn't the name of a new rap group. You know that Ludlow is 90% Portuguese and that Fall River is 90% Lebanese. You do not recognize the letter "R" as a part of the English language. You've called something "wicked pissa" You have driven to either Rhode Island, New Hampshire or Vermont for a tattoo. You see people like Steven Tyler (Aerosmith), Dicky Barret (The Mighty, Mighty Bosstones), and Evan Dando (The Lemonheads) in the local supermarket and it doesn't phase you. You've slammed on your brakes to deter a tailgater Know at least three Tony's, one Vinnie and a Frank(ie) Paranoia sets in if you can't see a Dunkin Donuts, ATM or CVS within eyeshot at all times. You keep an ice scraper and can of de-icer on the floor of your car...year round You still try to order curly fries from Burger King You order iced coffee in January You know what candlepin bowling is You drive 45 minutes to New Hampshire to save $5 in sales tax You've pulled out of a side street and used your car to block oncoming traffic so you can make a left. You've bragged about the money you've saved at The Christmas Tree Shop You know what a "regular" coffee is
